body_html: That's correct. Instead of creating the QueueRunner inside a branch of the cond, you should create it based on the result returned by the tf.cond() function. The fetchability of tensors is determined statically, before any optimizations take place, so the error will be raised even if the same branch is always taken.
body_text: That's correct. Instead of creating the QueueRunner inside a branch of the cond, you should create it based on the result returned by the tf.cond() function. The fetchability of tensors is determined statically, before any optimizations take place, so the error will be raised even if the same branch is always taken.
body: That's correct. Instead of creating the QueueRunner inside a branch of the cond, you should create it based on the result returned by the `tf.cond()` function. The fetchability of tensors is determined statically, before any optimizations take place, so the error will be raised even if the same branch is always taken.
